summary: The document is a journal entry from the Office of Legislative Counsel dated 10 November 1977, detailing various liaison activities and employment requests. It includes interactions with representatives' offices, handling of Privacy Act requests related to the House Select Committee on Assassinations, and a visit by a Senate Select Committee on Intelligence staff member. Activities addressed employment inquiries, shared press releases, fulfilled publication requests, arranged meetings, and managed Privacy Act requests without disclosing requesters' names.
key_findings: Employment inquiry for a constituent of Representative Douglas Applegate was addressed.
Press release regarding CIA tours was shared with a representative's office.
Request for a CIA publication on Soviet commercial operations was fulfilled.
A meeting was arranged with Professor G. Robert Blakey, Chief Counsel of the House Select Committee on Assassinations.
Privacy Act requests from the House Select Committee on Assassinations staff were acknowledged without disclosing requesters' names.
A Senate Select Committee on Intelligence staff member received a headquarters badge and reviewed NIS extracts related to foreign security services.
